subject: RE: [junit] Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
msgSnippet: Doesn t sound like a bad idea.  But would require some non-trivial changes to the core JUnit framework.  Have you scoped that out at all? Scott Stirling

Doesn't sound like a bad idea.  But would require some non-trivial
changes to the core JUnit framework.  Have you scoped that out at all?

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Vydra [mailto:yahoogroups@...] 
> Sent: Sunday, September 22, 2002 2:24 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Adding setUp() and tearDown() to TestSuite
> 
> 
> I would like to get the group's opinion about adding setUp() and 
> tearDown() methods to the TestSuite class. I think it has several 
> advantages:
> 
> 1. It makes it similar to TestCase
> 2. It makes it easier for QA engineers, who may not feel comfortable 
> with a decorator like TestSetup (no offense meant to QA engineers who 
> do)
> 3. Sometimes you need to access the suite in the composite after it 
> was wrapped in TestSetup.
> 
> Regards,
> 
> David
